chapter.title: The Service Layer
chapter.para: This section shows how the framework is integrated with CDI, Hibernate and EJB to provide database operations through Conventions Services which are components that link the framework to the backend infrastructure.

section.title: What's a Service?
section.para: In Conventions Framework services are components that have access to the backend infrastructure, below are some characterists of a service:

itemizedlist.listitem: has access to an entitymanager via EntityManagerProvider component
has access to a Hibernate session
built in and configurable pagination method

section.title: Where is the Dao?
section.para: Conventions framework does not have an explicit Dao layer(althought you can create one), the dao has a composition relashionship with the service layer so each service has a dao.
